snippet: In the first Republican contest of the season, the top two candidates were separated by only a sliver of votes, offering Rick Santorum a chance to emerge as the alternative to Mitt Romney.
abstract: Mitt Romney's quest to lock down the Republican nomination with a commanding finish in the Iowa caucuses is spoiled by the surging candidacy of Rick Santorum, who fights him to a draw on a shoestring budget by winning over conservatives skeptical of Romney; the two candidates were separated by only a sliver of votes and the outcome offers Santorum a chance to emerge as the alternative to Romney.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by A.G. Sulzberger in Alton, Iowa; Susan Saulny in Clive, Iowa; and Dalia Sussman and Allison Kopecki in New York.

lead_paragraph: In the first Republican contest of the season, the top two candidates were separated by only a sliver of votes, offering Rick Santorum a chance to emerge as the alternative to Mitt Romney.

headline.seo: Romney Wins Iowa Caucus by 8 Votes
headline.main: Romney Wins Iowa Caucus by 8 Votes
headline.print_headline: Dueling Romney, Santorum Surges In Iowa Caucuses
headline.sub: Beats Santorum in Iowa by 8 Votes; Paul Is Close Third
